Man, I feel really bad for Lena. She had been struggling her whole life trying to protect and fight for the 86 and even made fun of. She at least tried to be nice to the 86 while others just treated them like pigs, even if it didn't make them feel better, she tried everything that she could, like how is a 16 year old girl supposed to go against the whole nation and government to convince them that they are humans. And now she got told off that it was all for nothing. If I was in her place, I would definitely quit right at that moment.

Idk the fact they've all acting like regular teenagers completely unaffected by people dying all around them and the constant threat of death is incredibly awkward. Feels like whoever wrote this hasn't the faintest idea what war does to people, kinda ruins the immersion.
Did you watch the full episode?

It shows that they don't really have any hope of surviving the war and also have grown numb to the death of their comrades( they have spent 4-5 yrs in the war with barely any survivability) that they gave up wasting time being depressed and enjoying whatever little time they have left to live.Or better, let's just say that those who showed signs of depression or ptsd never survived ( you r not discharged from service)

I get what you mean and I think they do actually mourn the deaths of their comrades but then again the show would be very repetitive if it just keeps happening, 2 deaths in 3 episodes which means people are gonna start dropping fast. What the 86 said in the episode is that they don't fight for those noble reasons, they fight to survive. Some people like realism in military shows where characters show ptsd, trauma and etc but for the author I think he's going for more of a "survival of the fittest" plot.

Just to make it clear , he had every right to react the way he did against Lena , it was clear she understood this too. It's impressive they put up with her with little to no objections so far but seeing your comrades (family), die day after day , and this Alba girl trying to be all nice and friendly in her warm room with 0 risks to her life while they are out there conscripted and forced to fight is so hypocritical , she wouldn't have to be sorry if the Alba never forced these people to fight against their will. I am sure she will mature after this , because she is trying to be a good person and will do everything in her power to help the 86 survive.

Yes she is trying to help and is marginally better than the rest of the Handlers , but at the end of the day she hasn't changed a thing for them - they are still treated as pigs , forced to fight for a republic which doesn't even see them as human and then their deaths aren't even counted as deaths.
